verses.verse: (Job Replies: My Complaint Is Just) Then Job answered:
(Job 31.6) “O that my vexation were weighed and all my calamity laid in the balances!
(Prov 27.3) For then it would be heavier than the sand of the sea; therefore my words have been rash.
(Job 21.20; Ps 38.2; 88.15) For the arrows of the Almighty (Traditional rendering of Heb Shaddai) are in me; my spirit drinks their poison; the terrors of God are arrayed against me.
Does the wild ass bray over its grass or the ox low over its fodder?
Can that which is tasteless be eaten without salt, or is there any flavor in the juice of mallows? (Meaning of Heb uncertain)
My appetite refuses to touch them; they are like food that is loathsome to me. (Meaning of Heb uncertain)
(Job 14.13) “O that I might have my request and that God would grant my desire,
(1 Kings 19.4) that it would please God to crush me, that he would let loose his hand and cut me off!
(Lev 19.2; Job 23.11, 12; Isa 57.15; Hos 11.9) This would be my consolation; I would even exult (Meaning of Heb uncertain) in unrelenting pain, for I have not denied the words of the Holy One.
(Job 21.4) What is my strength, that I should wait? And what is my end, that I should be patient?
Is my strength the strength of stones, or is my flesh bronze?
(Job 26.2, 3) In truth I have no help in me, and any resource is driven from me.
“Those who withhold (Syr Vg Compare Tg: Meaning of Heb uncertain) kindness from a friend forsake the fear of the Almighty. (Traditional rendering of Heb Shaddai)
(Ps 38.11; Jer 15.18) My companions are treacherous like a torrent bed, like swollen streams that pass away,
that run dark with ice, turbid with melting snow.
(Job 24.19) In time of heat they disappear; when it is hot, they vanish from their place.
The caravans turn aside from their course; they go up into the waste and perish.
(Gen 25.15; 1 Kings 10.1; Isa 21.14) The caravans of Tema look; the travelers of Sheba hope.
(Jer 14.3) They are disappointed because they were confident; they come there and are confounded.
Such you have now become to me; (Cn Compare Gk Syr: Meaning of Heb uncertain) you see my calamity and are afraid.
Have I said, ‘Make me a gift’? Or, ‘From your wealth offer a bribe for me’?
Or, ‘Save me from an opponent’s hand’? Or, ‘Ransom me from the hand of oppressors’?
“Teach me, and I will be silent; make me understand how I have gone wrong.
(Eccl 12.10, 11) How forceful are honest words! But your reproof, what does it reprove?
(Job 8.2) Do you think that you can reprove words, as if the speech of the desperate were wind?
(Joel 3.3; 2 Pet 2.3) You would even cast lots over the orphan and bargain over your friend.
(Job 27.4) “But now, be pleased to look at me, for I will not lie to your face.
Turn, I pray; let no wrong be done. Turn now; my vindication is at stake.
(Job 12.11; 27.4) Is there any wrong on my tongue? Cannot my taste discern calamity?
